thread.title: Volkswagen India to launch Tiguan and new Passat in 2017 - The Financial Express
thread.title_full: Volkswagen India to launch Tiguan and new Passat in 2017 - The Financial Express

author: Fe Online
title: Volkswagen India to launch Tiguan and new Passat in 2017 - The Financial Express
text:
Volkswagen India to launch Tiguan and new Passat in 2017 Volkswagen India to launch Tiguan and new Passat in 2017 Volkswagen Tiguan has received much appreciation in the global markets and VW expects the SUV to generate the same response in India. By: FE Online | Published: February 23, 2017 1:06 PM Volkswagen Tiguan 
Volkswagen is working on strengthening its position in the India car market with addition of global products to its line-up and an enhanced network across the country with more sales and service outlets. The Tiguan and the all new Passat is ready to join VW line-up in India, which will also provide the brand presence in various segments and hence reach a wider audience. The Tiguan has received much appreciation in the global markets and VW expects the SUV to generate the same response in India. VW Passat, a luxury sedan, will compete against the likes of Toyota Camry and Honda Accord. 
“2017 marks 10 years for Volkswagen in India and at this opportune moment, we reiterate our commitment with a strong product line-up aimed at fostering our growth momentum in the country. With the successful launch of the Ameo and introduction of GTI recently, Volkswagen marked its presence in the Compact Sedan and Performance car segment. With exciting new products across the segments, we are now ready to enter the SUV segment with Tiguan and luxury segment with the all new Passat. The slew of launches will ensure every car buyer finds a car to meet their requirements at our showrooms,” Michael Mayer, Director, Volkswagen Passenger Cars India said abouth the 2017 launch announcement. Volkswagen Passat 
The Tiguan, powered by a 2.0L TDI engine paired to a 7-speed DSG gearbox, is a blend of luxurious interiors and a sporty performance. The second generation Tiguan has been a best-selling SUV in its class in the European markets. 
The new Passat is based on the MQB (modular transverse matrix) platform, and is powered by 2.0L TDI engine mated to a 6-speed DSG gearbox. It has also received many upgrades to the entertainment and safety features, which will include nine airbags. 
With the introduction of the new cars, Volkswagen can expect a wider market presence, with the Polo, Ameo, Vento being the frontline of the German car maker. Tags:
